newsitem.title: USA: Ivory Coast 1996-97 cocoa crop 1.1 mln tonnes-USDA.
newsitem.headline: Ivory Coast 1996-97 cocoa crop 1.1 mln tonnes-USDA.

text.p: The U.S. agriculture attache in Ivory Coast raised the forecast for the country's 1996-97 cocoa crop to 1.10 million tonnes, the U.S. Agriculture Department (USDA) said on Friday.
The attache in Jakarta raised the forecast for Indonesian cocoa production to 325,000 tonnes, the USDA said in a circular on tropical products.
The forecast for Brazil's 1996-97 production was unchanged at 198,000 tonnes.
The USDA said the Ivory Coast forecast was raised from an earlier 1.05 million tonnes because of improved prospects for the mid-crop. The main crop again was forecast at 900,000 tonnes.
The forecast for exports of cocoa and cocoa products in 1996-97 was raised to 1.21 million tonnes from 1.08 million tonnes because of higher carryover from last season.

Indonesia's forecast was raised 16 percent from a previous estimate of 280,000 tonnes because of an increase in bearing trees and a larger-than-expected expansion in cocoa area. USDA also raised its estimate of the 1995-96 crop to 305,000 tonnes from previous 275,000 tonnes.
Indonesian exports of cocoa and cocoa products in 1996-97 were forecast at 288,500 tonnes for Indonesia, including about 230,000 tonnes of cocoa beans.
Brazil was forecast to import 2,600 tonnes of cocoa and cocoa products in the 1996-97 season, which began October 1.
